com.github.codeteapot.tools.checksum

Class Checksum

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.codeteapot.tools.checksum.Checksum

  • public class Checksum
extends Object
    Checksum of a directory, based on the content of its files.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Checksum(MessageDigestCreator digestCreator, String algorithm, File directory, Predicate<String> ignoreFile)
      Checksum for the given directory.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Determines if this checksum matches with a checksum previously stored to the given file.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Detail

      • Checksum

        public Checksum(MessageDigestCreator digestCreator,
                String algorithm,
                File directory,
                Predicate<String> ignoreFile)
         throws IOException,
                NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Checksum for the given directory.
        Parameters:
        digestCreator - Creator of MessageDigest used for calculating the hash of the content of the directory files.
        algorithm - Algorithm used to calculate the hash of directory files content.
        directory - Directory where the checksum calculation is applied.
        ignoreFile - Predicate that determines the file with the given path relative to specified directory must be ignored.
        Throws:
        IOException - If some IO error has been occurred.
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - If the given algorithm is not known.

    • Method Detail

      • match

        public boolean match(File checksumFile)
              throws IOException
        Determines if this checksum matches with a checksum previously stored to the given file.

        If checksum file does not exist, it matches when this checksum was generated on a directory that does not contain any non-ignored regular file.

        Parameters:
        checksumFile - The file where checksum to compare is in.
        Returns:
        true if, and only if this checksum matches with a checksum stored on the given file.
        Throws:
        IOException - If some IO error has been occurred.

      • store

        public void store(File checksumFile)
           throws IOException
        Store this checksum to the given file.

        The content of the file is overwritten, or it is created if it does not exist.

        Parameters:
        checksumFile - The file where this checksum will be stored.
        Throws:
        IOException - If some IO error has been occurred.
